item.title: Development Environment with Buildah and Podman
item.description:
This is about having a development environment where you can build and run programs without installing the necessary compilers in your system directly. More specifically, the compilers will run inside containers, which in our case here will be built and run with Buildah and Podman. You can use Docker too if you want.

The cool kids are doing Rust now, so let’s use that for the example. Since this post is mostly about Buildah and Podman, I’ll assume that Rust/Cargo is already set up properly in your system.

Installation

I’m using Arch, so pacman for me:

sudo pacman -S buildah podman

Set up subuid and subgid:

sudo touch /etc/subuid /etc/subgid
sudo usermod --add-subuids 100000-165535 --add-subgids 100000-165535 vagrant

Note: Replace vagrant with the actual username you need.

You can read more about subuid and subgid here.

That should be all!

Verify Installation

Let’s make sure both Buildah and Podman are working correctly.

Commands were stolen from here with pretty much no modification.

Buildah

For Buildah, create a Containerfile (or Dockerfile if you want) somewhere with this content:

# Base on the most recently released Fedora
FROM fedora:latest
MAINTAINER ipbabble email buildahboy@redhat.com # not a real email

# Install updates and httpd
RUN echo "Updating all fedora packages"; dnf -y update; dnf -y clean all
RUN echo "Installing httpd"; dnf -y install httpd && dnf -y clean all

# Expose the default httpd port 80
EXPOSE 80

# Run the httpd
CMD ["/usr/sbin/httpd", "-DFOREGROUND"]

Build an image with Buildah:

buildah build -t fedora-httpd

If Buildah is working correctly, then you should get an output like this:

...
Writing manifest to image destination
Storing signatures
--> 4eb47351679
Successfully tagged localhost/fedora-httpd:latest
4eb47351679b2983655b4ed5487ec438b34d6034686ebfe3c204072612c6bb63

Podman

Now let’s run a container with Podman:

podman run --rm -p 8123:80 fedora-httpd

And since there’s a HTTP server running now, you might as well hit it with curl (on another terminal) to verify that it’s working:

curl localhost:8123

If Podman works correctly, you should get a test HTML page as the output. You can stop the container running the HTTP server now (with Ctrl+C, nothing special).

Cleanup

If you want to be clean, you can get rid of all the test images we created above:

buildah rmi fedora fedora-httpd

Rust development environment using Buildah and Podman

Now that Buildah and Podman are confirmed working, let’s use them to build a simple Rust project. Let’s start with creating a new project with Cargo.

cargo new --bin testproject

Create a Containerfile inside the project directory with this content:

FROM docker.io/rust:1.60

COPY ./ ./

RUN cargo build --release

Now use Buildah to build the binary:

buildah build -t testproject

You should be able to see something like this inside the output:

...
STEP 3/3: RUN cargo build --release
   Compiling testproject v0.1.0 (/)
    Finished release [optimized] target(s) in 2.34s
COMMIT testproject
...

Now use Podman to run the binary built:

podman run --rm testproject ./target/release/testproject

You should get the expected output:

Hello, world!

That’s all!

There are more advanced things to do, but I have no interest in writing it. Someone else on the internet has probably written it already :)

Troubleshooting

This section will not be comprehensive. It’s just where I record the errors I got myself.

fuse-overlayfs

If you get an error like this:

Error: kernel does not support overlay fs: 'overlay' is not supported over <unknown> at "/home/vagrant/.local/share/containers/storage/overlay": backing file system is unsupported for this graph driver

Then install fuse-overlayfs:

sudo pacman -S fuse-overlayfs

Then, edit containers.conf according to the doc here. For me, I only had to uncomment the mount_program line in /etc/containers/storage.conf like this:

...
# Path to an helper program to use for mounting the file system instead of mounting it
# directly.
mount_program = "/usr/bin/fuse-overlayfs"
...

References

  • https://docs.podman.io/en/latest/Introduction.html
  • https://github.com/containers/podman/blob/main/docs/tutorials/rootless_tutorial.md
  • https://wiki.archlinux.org/title/Podman
  • https://rootlesscontaine.rs/

item.title: Whereabouts of Light (星の在り処) Comments
item.description:
Whereabouts of Light, or 星の在り処 (hoshi no arika), is the ending song of Trails in the Sky FC. There will be spoilers in this post, you have been warned.

Players get to hear this song in many places in Sky. From the initial opening scene of Sky FC, somewhere in mid-game of both Sky FC and SC, the full song at the end of Sky FC, and hell, even the tune you hear when the ‘Falcom’ logo is shown when you boot up the Sky FC game is actually part of the full song.

Lore

The song itself has a role to play in the story. At the end of FC, when you can hear the harmonica version of the song playing in the background in the palace, if you talk with Olivier Lenheim before meeting up with Joshua, Olivier will tell you a bit about the song. Here is the conversation:

Olivier: Oh-ho. 'tis young Joshua's performance, is it not?
Olivier: I heard him playing by the lake, but this...this is not mere playing, it's the weaving of the melody; the chisel of a sculptor or brush of a painter!
Olivier: He's been practicing, I surmise.
Estelle: He did play a lot when he was a kid.
Estelle: He played other songs, but this was the one he'd always come back to.
Olivier: Was it, now...?
Olivier: It's quite a surprise to hear Joshua play such a delicately beautiful yet obscure song.
Olivier: There are few enough Imperials who still remember it, much less Liberlians!
Estelle: Wait, so it's...an Erebonian song?
Olivier: Indeed. 'The Whereabouts of Light.'
Olivier: A very old Erebonian melody.
Olivier: A perennial favourite of the country folk, in fact.
Estelle: Wow. I had no idea...

Here’s a YouTube video for that scene.

Anyway, so, an Erebonian song, popular with the country folk, but… also obscure? So, which is it, obscure or popular? Maybe obscure for Erebonian in general but popular only with the country folk? I don’t know. Anyway, moving on.

In Trails of Cold Steel 1, Chapter 6, this song was mentioned by Misty in ‘Abend Time’, a radio talk show in Trista that Rean listens to in his dorm. This is what she said about it:

...
Misty: But as far as music goes, I'm a sucker for the classics. I still sing along whenever I hear 'The Whereabouts of Light.'
Misty: I stare in disbelief... As you fade away... Like a dimming star... Beneath the coming day...
Misty: ...Heehee. Whoa, there! Almost felt like I was in my shower back home.
...

Well, the lyrics sang here are definitely a translation issue. It was sang totally incorrectly too, but, well, that’s the limit of translations I guess. Ideally this part shouldn’t have been translated, but well, it would be weird to have only this part of the game untranslated.

I found a YouTube video with the Japanese voiceacting (this one), and actually, she sang the first line of the song (correctly):

君の影星のように　朝に溶けて消えていく
    kimi no kage hoshi no you ni asa ni tokete kiete yuku

Since Misty mentions this song casually in Abend Time (I guess with some expectations that the audiences will know about the song), maybe it’s actually supposed to be a popular song, not obscure at all. Maybe some translation errors in Sky FC, but I’m too lazy to hunt for the Japanese version of the scene on YouTube. Or maybe an actual error in the script, I don’t know.

Lyrics

Comments

I posted (well, copy-and-pasted) the full lyrics here.

Despite the song having a significance in the story, it seems like the lyrics were written to match the ending of Sky FC (the separation of Estelle and Joshua), from Estelle’s perspective. This is understandable, of course, to make the ending as soul-crushing as possible for the players.

I don’t have many comments about the lyrics here. They are mostly about separation and the hope to meet again one day. There’s also a slight hint about the circumstances in Sky FC where Estelle being mostly carefree while Joshua knowing the situation a bit more:

さよならを知らないで　夢見たのは一人きり
あの頃の君の目には　何が映っていたの？

Translation Nitpicks

There are a few things about the English translations I copied that I want to nitpick:

孤独とか痛みとか　どんな君も感じたい
もう一度見つめ合えれば　願いはきっと叶う
    Be it loneliness or pain, I want to feel you no matter what.
    If we can look each other in the eyes once more, our wish will surely come true.

I prefer to translate this to:

孤独とか痛みとか　どんな君も感じたい
もう一度見つめ合えれば　願いはきっと叶う
    I want to feel you, regardless of if you are (currently) lonely or in pain.
    If only we can look at each other again... surely the wish will come true.

‘The wish’ here referring to the ‘be able to look at each other again’ part.

Here is another nitpick:

愛してるただそれだけで　二人はいつかまた会える
    I love you, it's that simple, so the two of us will be able to meet again.

I prefer to translate it to:

愛してるただそれだけで　二人はいつかまた会える
    I love you, just that.
    The two of us will one day meet again.

item.title: Whereabouts of Light (星の在り処) Lyrics
item.description:
All these were taken from here. I only made minor adjustments to the formatting. My comments about this song are here.

君の影星のように　朝に溶けて消えていく
行き先を失くしたまま　想いは溢れてくる
    kimi no kage hoshi no you ni asa ni tokete kiete yuku
    ikisaki wo nakushita mama omoi wa afuretekuru
        Your shadow, like the stars, will dissolve into the morning sky and disappear.
        I have lost your whereabouts, but my thoughts of you are overflowing.

強さにも弱さにも　この心は向き合えた
君とならどんな明日が　来ても怖くないのに
    tsuyosa ni mo yowasa ni mo kono kokoro wa mukiaeta
    kimi to nara donna ashita ga kite mo kowakunai noni
        My heart was able to face both strength and weakness.
        As long as I'm with you, I won't fear tomorrow no matter what it's like.

二人歩いた時を　信じていて欲しい
    futari aruita toki wo shinjiteite hoshii
        Please believe in the times when the two of us were walking together.

真実も嘘もなく　夜が明けて朝が来る
星空が朝に溶けても　君の輝きはわかるよ
    shinjitsu mo uso mo naku yoru ga akete asa ga kuru
    hoshizora ga asa ni tokete mo kimi no kagayaki wa wakaru yo
        There's no truth or lie; dawn will break, and morning will come.
        Even when the starry sky dissolves at dawn, I will still be able to identify your shine.

さよならを知らないで　夢見たのは一人きり
あの頃の君の目には　何が映っていたの？
    sayonara wo shiranai de yumemita no wa hitorikiri
    ano koro no kimi no me ni wa nani ga utsutteita no?
        Not knowing what "goodbye" is, I was dreaming all by myself.
        At that time, in your eyes, what was being reflected?

二人つないだ時を　誰も消せはしない
    futari tsunaida toki wo dare mo kese wa shinai
        The times when the two of us were connected, no one will ever erase them.

孤独とか痛みとか　どんな君も感じたい
もう一度見つめ合えれば　願いはきっと叶う
    kodoku toka itami toka donna kimi mo kanjitai
    mou ichido mitsumeaereba negai wa kitto kanau
        Be it loneliness or pain, I want to feel you no matter what.
        If we can look each other in the eyes once more, our wish will surely come true.

夜明け前まどろみに　風が頬を　流れていく
君の声君の香りが　全てを包んで満ちていく
    yoake mae madoromi ni kaze ga hoho wo nagareteiku
    kimi no koe kimi no kaori ga subete wo tsutsunde michiteiku
        Before the break of dawn, the wind flows down our cheeks mesmerizingly.
        Your voice and your fragrance, they engulfed and filled up my everything.

思い出を羽ばたかせ　君の空へ舞い上がる
星空が朝に溶けても　君の輝きはわかるよ
    omoide wo habatakase kimi no sora e maiagaru
    hoshizora ga asa ni tokete mo kimi no kagayaki wa wakaru yo
        Let the memories fly, then they will soar up to your sky.
        Even when the starry sky dissolves at dawn, I will still be able to identify your shine.

愛してるただそれだけで　二人はいつかまた会える
    aishiteru tada sore dake de futari wa itsuka mata aeru
        I love you, it's that simple, so the two of us will be able to meet again.

item.title: Trails in the Sky
item.description:
I recently finished playing The Legend of Heroes: Trails in the Sky games (英雄伝説 空の軌跡).

I finished all the obvious quests (those on the job board and all the doors in the 3rd), but I didn’t 100% the game. Oh well.

My play time according to Steam:

  • SC: 45 hours
  • 3rd: 45 hours

My play time according to the game itself, which is different from the real time because of the in-game speedups:

  • FC: 59 hours
  • SC: 86 hours
  • 3rd: 79 hours

item.title: Setting up machine learning development environment
item.description:
I decided to write this after facing the surprisingly annoying process of installing various packages for machine learning purposes.

Let’s start from the beginning. Create an environment on anaconda:

conda create -n pytorch-env python=3

Switch to the pytorch-env environment:

conda activate pytorch-env

Install PyTorch according to the official documentation. Notice that it includes cpuonly instead of cudatoolkit. This means that there will be no CUDA support, which is intentional because I’m doing this in a VM.

conda install pytorch torchvision torchaudio cpuonly -c pytorch

Install some other packages commonly used for ML:

conda install opencv matplotlib jupyterlab nb_conda

This is the point where I got this message:

Solving environment: -
Found conflicts! Looking for incompatible packages.
This can take several minutes.  Press CTRL-C to abort.

This took a really long time to finish, with failures on top of that. Some suggestions like updating packages (conda update --all) and allowing downgrades (conda config --set allow_conda_downgrades true) didn’t help at all.

Turns out the solution is quite simple, just install from pytorch channel as well:

conda install -c pytorch opencv matplotlib jupyterlab nb_conda

I saw some packages downgraded when I did that:

  certifi                          2020.12.5-py38h06a4308_0 --> 2020.12.5-py37h06a4308_0
  mkl-service                          2.3.0-py38he904b0f_0 --> 2.3.0-py37he8ac12f_0
  mkl_fft                              1.2.1-py38h54f3939_0 --> 1.2.1-py37h54f3939_0
  mkl_random                           1.1.1-py38h0573a6f_0 --> 1.1.1-py37h0573a6f_0
  ninja                               1.10.2-py38hff7bd54_0 --> 1.10.2-py37hff7bd54_0
  numpy                               1.19.2-py38h54aff64_0 --> 1.19.2-py37h54aff64_0
  numpy-base                          1.19.2-py38hfa32c7d_0 --> 1.19.2-py37hfa32c7d_0
  pillow                               8.1.0-py38he98fc37_0 --> 8.1.0-py37he98fc37_0
  pip                                 21.0.1-py38h06a4308_0 --> 21.0.1-py37h06a4308_0
  python                                   3.8.5-h7579374_1 --> 3.7.9-h7579374_0
  pytorch                                 1.7.1-py3.8_cpu_0 --> 1.7.1-py3.7_cpu_0
  setuptools                          52.0.0-py38h06a4308_0 --> 52.0.0-py37h06a4308_0
  six                                 1.15.0-py38h06a4308_0 --> 1.15.0-py37h06a4308_0
  torchaudio                                     0.7.2-py38 --> 0.7.2-py37
  torchvision                                0.8.2-py38_cpu --> 0.8.2-py37_cpu

My guess is that the default channel (and conda-forge too, I tried) didn’t have the older versions of some packages installed through pytorch in the earlier step, so conda just gave up instead.

item.title: Synology Router Manager broken in Firefox
item.description:
Synology Router Manager (SRM) is the name of web interface to manage your Synology Router RT2600ac device. For me, my SRM address is configured as http://router.synology.com:8000/webman/index.cgi.

Recently, when I opened it on Firefox, I got an error page saying something like this:

An error occurred during a connection to router.synology.com:8000. PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR

I was able to open it just fine on Chrome, so it seemed that Firefox screwed up somewhere.

Upon further examination, I noticed that on Firefox, I was redirected to HTTPS, so I was actually visiting https://router.synology.com:8000/webman/index.cgi.

I confirmed that the Automatically redirect HTTP connections to HTTPS and Enable HSTS checkboxes in SRM Control Panel were both NOT checked, so why was this happening?

Turns out, there is a totally-not-new concept of HSTS preloading, apparently started in Chrome, but Firefox has followed suit. Taking a look at the list preloaded by Firefox (available here, look for nsSTSPreloadList.inc), seems like synology.com is included in the list.

So, maybe Firefox considers router.synology.com:8000 the same as synology.com? Anyway, the fix is clear:

  • Open up about:config
  • Find network.stricttransportsecurity.preloadlist
  • Flip it to false

Done! Shamelessly stolen from this StackOverflow answer.

Note: This was Firefox 76.0.1 and Chrome 81.0.4044.138 respectively.

item.title: Arch Linux broken desktop environment in VirtualBox
item.description:
I updated my Arch VM with the usual command:

pacman -Syu

Then, upon rebooting the VM, after logging-in again, the desktop environment would only show a black screen. I was still able to bring up tty2 with Ctrl + Alt + F2, so it seemed like other than the desktop environment, the VM was running just fine.

After some debugging, I suspected that virtualbox-guest-utils package was the culprit. Checking through the update log, it seemed like that package was indeed updated:

cat /var/log/pacman.log
...
[2020-05-17T21:21:34+0900] [ALPM] upgraded xorg-bdftopcf (1.1-1 -> 1.1-2)
[2020-05-17T21:21:34+0900] [ALPM] upgraded ttf-hack (3.003-1 -> 3.003-2)
[2020-05-17T21:21:34+0900] [ALPM] upgraded virtualbox-guest-utils (6.1.6-1 -> 6.1.8-1)
[2020-05-17T21:21:34+0900] [ALPM] upgraded vlc (3.0.8-13 -> 3.0.10-1)
[2020-05-17T21:21:34+0900] [ALPM] upgraded vte-common (0.60.1-1 -> 0.60.2-2)
...

I downgraded back to 6.1.6-1 and things are now good again:

sudo pacman -U https://archive.archlinux.org/packages/v/virtualbox-guest-utils/virtualbox-guest-utils-6.1.6-1-x86_64.pkg.tar.zst

The worst thing about this was that there was no clipboard sharing at the time (because all GUIs were broken), so I had to type the whole URL on the terminal myself :(
